title: Sam and Nia Rader reveal miscarriage news in YouTube video
text:
THEY announced their pregnancy just days ago in a flurry of excitement with a video that quickly went viral.
But lifestyle vloggers Sam and Nia Rader have revealed the devastating news that they have suffered a miscarriage.
“It just, bam, it just hit us like a bomb,” Nia said in her latest video. “And those of you who have experienced miscarriage before, I can relate now. I have felt my womb empty out. I never ever ever knew that women felt that way.”
Unbearable ... the pain of her loss is too much for Nia Rader. Source: Facebook
Nia and Sam's tragic news
The couple, from Texas, post a video of their life on YouTube each day.
They became an internet sensation last year after a video of them miming to Love Is An Open Door from the hit Disney film Frozen went viral.
When announcing their pregnancy, Sam said he snuck his wife’s urine sample from the toilet to conduct a pregnancy test and surprise her with the news that she was pregnant.
The joyful video was viewed more than 10 million times before the couple went silent for a few days.
Full of joy ... the couple told the world about their pregnancy. Source: Supplied
They then took to YouTube on Sunday to reveal their sad news in a video titled “Our baby had a heartbeat”.
Nia and Sam, who have two young children, said they posted the video in the hope that it would help others who had suffered miscarriages.
“I just want to say, too, that maybe there’s someone out there that’s going through this with us,” Nia said in the video.
“The Bible says to weep with those who weep and mourn with those who mourn, and I am mourning with those of you who are feeling this.”
 Couple reveal devastating baby news
